tool.name: TreeScaper-CRA
tool.description:
(Warning: The current version of this wrapper does not fail if the underlying CLVTreeScaper2 program fails. This is done so that the job status file can be retrieved and output, as well as any finished results. The job may not have run to completion, even if it appeared successful. Check the job_status file to verify all jobs run to completion.)
Phylogenomic / Generate bootstrap trees via the CIPRES REST API.
tool.command:
#set $input_file = "input_file.txt" #if $tool.id == 'RAXMLHPC8_REST_XSEDE': #set $output_suffix = "RAxML_bootstrap.result" #else if $tool.id == 'IQTREE_XSEDE': #set $output_suffix = "output.treefile" #end if
#for $input in $input_collection: echo $input.element_identifier >> $input_file && ln -s $input $input.element_identifier && #end for
#if $status_file cat $status_file > $input_file && #end if
cat $cra_params > params.txt &&
$__tool_directory__/CLVTreeScaper2 -cra -f $input_file -p $cra_params -cl debug;
#for $input in $input_collection: #set $output_trees = "cra_output/" + $input.element_identifier + "_" + $output_suffix echo -n "$input.element_identifier " >> composite.results && [[ -f $output_trees ]] && cat $output_trees >> composite.results || echo NO_OUTPUT >> composite.results; grep -v NO_OUTPUT composite.results | awk '{print $2}' > composite.trees; #end for

param.name: status_file
param.label: Status file output by previous run of TreeScaper. Can be used to resume job submission if interrupted.

param.name: bootstrap_type_
param.label: Bootstrap type
param.option: Non-parametric. Omit analysis on original alignment.

data.name: composite.results
data.label: Bootstrap results (all results from input collection).

data.name: composite.trees
data.label: Bootstrap trees (all successful output trees from input collection).
